articles.title: Lessons to learn after Australia's 'formality' win
articles.description: Australia's win in the Women's T20 World Cup was a "formality", and despite some encouraging signs, there are concerns for women's cricket, writes BBC Sport's Ffion Wynne.
articles.content:
Is it possible to get bored of winning? 
"No. Not at all," is the answer, according to Women's T20 World Cup winner and player of the tournament, Australia's Ash Gardner. 
But when one team is so d… [+6028 chars]

articles.title: 'Even without trying, England produce compelling Test'
articles.description: Having to chase 258 to win would not have been in England's plan after they asked New Zealand to follow on, but it sticks to their desire for compelling Test cricket, writes Stephan Shemilt.
articles.content:
England's desire to think outside the box resulted in Harry Brook taking his first Test wicket and New Zealand losing their last five wickets for 28 runs
Even without trying, England have produced a… [+4965 chars]

articles.title: PCB hands Umar Akmal three-year ban from all cricket | ESPNcricinfo.com
articles.description: Penalty after the batsman pleaded guilty to not reporting corrupt approaches | ESPNcricinfo.com
articles.content: Umar Akmal's troubled cricket career has hit its biggest roadblock yet, with the PCB handing him a ban from all representative cricket for three years after he pleaded guilty of failing to report det… [+1506 chars]

articles.title: What we learned from watching the 1992 World Cup final in full again | ESPNcricinfo.com
articles.description: Wides, lbw calls, swing - plenty of things were different in white-ball cricket back then | ESPNcricinfo.com
articles.content: Last week, we at ESPNcricinfo did something we have been thinking of doing for eight years now: pretend-live ball-by-ball commentary for a classic cricket match. We knew the result, yes, but we tried… [+6823 chars]
